content.question: If <math alttext="f of x equals, tangent x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="the limit as x approaches the fraction pi over 4, of, the fraction with numerator f of x, minus, f of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 4, close parenthesis, and denominator x minus the fraction pi over 4, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is

choices.label: <math alttext="the tangent of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="secant squared of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>sec</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="secant squared of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>sec</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.10: Finding the Derivatives of Tangent, Cotangent, Secant, and/or Cosecant Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
